111.content:
"Jake!" the young man hears a shout that goes through his spine and wakes him up "JAKE!" Veronica shouted again.
Then she got close and started to shake Jake.
"Jake, are you all right?" she asked while shaking him.
"Yes.." Jake said a bit weak. He put one hand over his right eye and rubbed it.

Somehow a small meteor had hit only meters besides him and the shock had thrown him off his legs and nearly popped his eardrums.
He was the only one close by and not the kind of guy who'd chicken from a space rock so he approached it immediately once he was on his feet again.
The crate was pretty small too. Just enough space for one collapsed guy besides the meteor...
A strange glow had caught his interest while he stepped into the crate, but once he touched the glowing stuff that was coming from the meteor everything went black!

The next thing he knew was that Veronica was shaking him.
He intended to continue the day as normal but pretty much all the other students who had assembled dragged him to the teachers who called an ambulance.
In the hospital they made their thing and figured that he was alright so they sent him home.
This night he had strange dreams and in the morning one message was burned into his consciousness:

Will he find out just how real his power is?

How exactly? Andrew didn't know how to put into words, but it felt like his whole skin was moving like crazy even though nothing appeared to be wrong on the outside. The feeling of motion was enough for him to forget about his poor laptop for the moment and rush to the bathroom.

Opening up the lid on the toilet, he lurched forward and then threw up, it wasn't like he was feeling nauseous or anything, but his skin was crawling like crazy and he couldn't shake it off. it just made his stomach churn enough to want him to spill out the lunch he had earlier.

Hearing the loud noises from the bathroom, both Heather and Martha were out of their respective grounds to come popping their heads into the bathroom that Andrew didn't bother closing since he didn't have enough time.

"Ew..." Heather couldn't help mutter. Her comments were not helping Andrew and only made him feel irritated.

Martha grew concerned and moved into the bathroom, placing a hand on her son's back as he focused all of his efforts to calm down.

"Sweetie? Do you need to go to the hospital? What happened?"

Asking these questions, Andrew couldn't respond yet as he tried to regain his breath, but those questions are something even he is trying to figure out. Feeling himself grow less likely to throw up again, especially since there's nothing left in his stomach, he pulled some toilet paper to clean his mouth and flushed everything in the toilet, closing the lid.

"I'm...yeah, maybe I need to go to the hospital," Andrew decides, about to hesitate on whether he wants to make this as big as it seems, but feeling his own skin crawl, he decides to not risk anything.

Pulling himself up, his head feels like spinning, especially since he was leaning into the toilet for what seemed a while. Swaying, Martha sees her son about to fall and she moves into quickly support him.

Yet when his mother moves in more closely to him, his body reacts strangely.

How strange?

1211211.content:
Martha recollected herself. Her heart was still pounding but seeing her only son in front of her eyes was enough to feel immensely relieved. In her mind, this was something out of the hands of any doctor.

"No!" Martha said firmly, surprising Andrew and Heather, "This is not normal, Andrew! It's too scary and strange! We need to figure out what's going on before we attract any unwanted attention. Right now, how are you feeling?"

Andrew furrows his eyes as he stares at his mother complicated. He gets what she is trying to say and doubts that anyone before him had this issue. The fact that he's not dead and was able to pull himself together after disintegrating confirmed that. Still...he's scared too about what's occurring with his body and if there's a slim chance that someone is able to help him, he'd gladly take up that offer.

For now, since he's not particularly feeling bad except for the fact that he felt like he needed to retain more control over his body, he decides to stay for the moment.

"I...let's see..." Andrew tries to recall as he answers his mother, "...my laptop just died and I tried to fix it. Then one moment when I was screwing out something, I...I guess I passed out? I'm not sure, but after that, I felt a sickness in my stomach and here we are."

Heather focuses on the conversation, now calming herself down as she sees that her brother is still himself. She frowns and pipes in.

"Did you have your laptop plugged in?"

Andrew raised his eyebrows and then widens his eyes slowly. "Actually..."

Heather takes a deep breath, more for herself, but also to show that she's quite disappointed in her brother. "So maybe...you passed out because you were shocked. Don't you think that's a possibility?"

Andrew narrows his eyes at his sister's logic. He didn't want to admit it, but that was a stupid oversight on his part. He grumbles a little as he sees his sister slowly regain some of her colors back and smile cockily.

"Yeah..." he answers quietly.

"Andrew, you should be more careful!" Martha couldn't help but admonish her son which caused Andrew to lower his head.

"H-hey, I'm sorry...but I'm fine, right? I mean, this is still bad, but I'm alive and I can at least pull myself together, it seems."

Heather scoffs. "Hardly, I think you're barely alive if you need to pull yourself."

"Heather, let's not be insensitive here! Right now, we all need to calm down and try to support Andrew. Maybe we can find someone who knows better and can help him, but until then, this must not be revealed to anyone."

Focusing her eyes on her son, she smiles solemnly. "Andrew, listen to me. If you ever feel strange, then we'll head to the hospital as a the very last resort but before that, come to us first, okay?"

Andrew nods hesitantly, but he wasn't sure what they could help with. If anything, he couldn't live like this so he needed to figure out quickly what's going on with his body. He wasn't sure how his mother and sister would react to that idea, but they were already involved by knowing about his new condition.

After stumbling around without a goal Richard came to stop infront of a little replica of a Maya temple. On the sign he reads that the thing actually isn't a replica of something, but an artifact from some native south American tribe.
"They used to sacrifice things to 'the gods' "
He read.
"The legend says that there was only one correct sacrifice,
the most valuable to every man, and that the one who solved
this 'riddle' would receive a gift from the gods"

Richard loved legends and myths. He thought for a quick moment and then glanced left and right.
There were only a few guest in this room other than his class, and they were all distracted by bigger things while his class was listening to the guide. Most of them bored.

After he had confirmed that no one was watching he pulled on a "string" of flesh on his finger and immediately started to bleed. He let a drop of blood drip on the artefact and quickly went to where his class was to not stick out.
While walking away he thought that he heared a hiss from the direction of the artifact but since he was always sure to keep fantasy and reality strictly separated he didn't turn around and convinced himself that he didn't hear anything real.

Richard didn't knew but he had solved the riddle. (the 'gods' intention was to show the humans how pitiful they are, as the thing any human values most highly is his himself.)

He took very slow steps as he saw gis sister lying on her bed in a very unladylike pose. He had to suppress a laugh. Richard stepped infront of wardrobe. Out of curiosity he took the lowest placed piece of every kind of clothing from every drawer, so he silently left her room again with a pair of panties, the leggings, a bra, a tanktop, socks, gloves, a hat and a scarf. He even found a sleeping mask on the ground but let it go for a Halloween mask that would cover his entire face.

Richard quickly hid everything under his matress and pulled the leggings out again. He had taken the risk of being caught stealing his sister's clothes just for that one thought and was now curious to the bone.
The leggings were black and appeared to be too small, but he would still manage to put them on.

He finally stopped hesitating and just pulled them on.
There was no morph going on. His legs and hips had been immediately replaced by shorter, thinner legs and thicker hips and thigs. Richard felt his new legs und the leggings. He had lost a good amount of size due to the swap.

Placed before a choice to either continue or check on gis sister he did the second.
Katy's door opened once more and Richard leaned in again. His sister has had a change of position but she was still sleeping. Richard snuck close. When he saw her up close he could see how the swap had affected her. She now possessed his legs. This was an interesting thing for sure.
He had to suppress another laugh when he noticed how ridiculous his hairy legs looked on his sister. He snuck back to his room.

What should he do?

Amber and Kole were both 26 and married for 3 years.
Kole worked as a metal worker. Not because he couldn't have gotten and office job, he had a college degree after all, but because he couldn't stand sitting around all day doing, by his definition, nothing.

Amber worked part time as a secretary.

1411.content:
Amber was still yawning as the presentation continued on. She rubbed her eyes to keep herself awake, but it was really difficult. First Kole kept her up all night with his incessant snoring and second she had to be here early to prepare the presentation. Mr. Deasly, her boss, was rattling on about one of the objects he found on his latest expedition. Amber didn't mind that Mr. Deasly was the kind of man who would go off on adventure and bring back tales of his adventures, but the voice he told it with was so boring that it would make the living dead go to sleep again.

Amber looked at the statue Mr. Deasly brought with him. It was a statue of a tiny woman with an angry face, one hand was spread out and the other was held in a fist. It as a bizarre looking thing for sure. As Amber prepared the presentation she knew that no one knew who or what it was. The locals took one look at the statue and ran away as fast as possible. Only one old lady told them it was a statue that would grant a wish to a woman of it's choice. Some information that was, as there were no women around when mr. Deasly was digging.

So mr. Deasly brought the statue back to add to his collection. Amber suppressed another yawn as she watched Mr. Deasly going around the podium. That was when Amber noticed the statue was slightly balancing on the edge of it's pedestal. Mr. Deasly was a rather huge man and the podium would occasional shake when he was walking around on it.

At the moment Mr. Deasly was near the end of his presentation he gave a big slap and the next moment Amber saw the statue fall of it's pedestal. Without knowing why Amber jumped at the statue, grabbing it just in time. As Mr. Deasly noticed what happened, Amber suddenly fell a strange tingling sensation coming from the statue. Her mind told Amber to throw the statue away, but her hands were stuck to it. Then Amber noticed a light coming from the statue rendering her unconscious. She only remembered from the statue saying she would be able to...
1411.title: Amber

14111.content: What was Amber capable of swapping?
14111.title: swap

141111.content:
Before Amber passed out she heard an old and cackley voice telling her: "I appreciate your kindness young lady to try and save me and therefore I will allow you to swap your current vessel for another one. Just touch the one you want to trade with and you will be inside that vessel and the other one in your vessel. But beware though, sometimes you should be glad with what you have."

The next moment Amber opened her eyes as she looked up to a white ceiling. Amber was still a little hazy as she tried to get her bearing.

"Amber, you're awake, you scared me shitless!" A female voice said next to her. Amber looked up and saw Keisha sitting next to her. Keisha was another secretary at the firm together with Amber. Amber and Keisha had a good relationship, though she was a bit lazy sometimes.

"Yeah, no kidding. I feel like I was hit by a truck. What happened with me Keish?" Amber asked as she moved herself up feeling a wet cloth on her head.

"We seriously don't know, one moment we see you catching that statue, next thing the statue bamboozled into thin air and you were lying on the ground." Keisha explained as she told Amber.

"Wow, that's really weird." Amber said still trying to get her bearing.

"It's fucked up, girl." Keisha agreed on. "Anyway, since the statue was gone, Daddy D (Keisha's nickname for Mr. Deasly), blew off the presentation. We were told to take care of you, so we did."

"I'm glad you did. You didn't call Kole, did you?" Amber asked hesitant. She knew it was important for him to know, but he could be such a worrywart sometimes.

Keisha shook her head to Amber's question. "No, I know how Kole reacts, one word and he's off. So I convinced Heather to let it slide. Told her that I would drop you off, if you were still unconscious."

"Heather? She's still here?" Amber asked surprised as she looked at the clock. Heather was in charge of the bookkeeping at the company. Amber and Keisha considered her to be a bit of a weirdo. She was in her forties and still single, not having the least of interest in men (or women). She usually kept to herself during breaks, often looking on her phone. And she had these standard rituals, like coffee at half past 9, having a break at 12 precise and leaving the office at half past 5. It's what made Amber confused.

"Yeah, me and her both carried you upstairs and she was the one that got the wet cloth. Man, I always forget such things." Keisha told Amber with a smile.

The door opened up and Heather came inside. She looked worried for a second, but then it was replaced by her usual motionless expression.

"Good, you look fine." She said standing closer to Amber inspecting her. She put her hand on her forehead which felt cold to Amber. "Your temperature feels okay. I suggest you go home now."

"Amber travels with the bus, so I don't think that's cool. How about you wait up for me while I take care of cleaning the stage downstairs? Then I can take you home." Keisha offered.

"I could also drive you home. That is no problem." Heather offered Amber which surprised Amber even more than the fact that she stayed here for her. Amber wasn't sure what to do. Stay here for Keisha to bring her home or let Heather take her home?"

Who to pick?
141111.title: bodies.

info.description:
The story is supposed to revolve about the swapping, morphing, copying, stealing, etc. of traits, body parts, whole bodys, life and the like.
In general everything that falls into that category is welcomed, including:
TG, WG, AR, AP, shrinking, growing and more.

2500 GP per addition with over 2000 characters.
1500 GP if you ignore how things worked in foregoing chapters.
250 GP for interesting choice chapters.

I would be happy about good grammar.
I will most likely correct the typos and grammatical mistakes.
If you find a typo or a grammatical mistakes you can mail me and I will correct it. This includes errors I make too.

If the grammar is really bad and it doesn't have any story I might end up deleting but more likely rewrite the chapter.
In general I am even happy if you add choice chapters as long as they bring in some fresh thoughts, though I'd rather you message me about new ideas.

If you have good ideas you can mail me and if you want we can develop some chapters together.
